text: this brownie recipe from violet bakery
in London uses cocoa powder for depth
melted chocolate for roundness and then
rye flour just turn that little
something extra special first thing you
have to do is melt the chocolate and the
best way to do that is to use a double
boiler but if you don't have a double
boiler you can also just use a pot and a
ball
so in this pot I have an inch of
steaming water and what I'm gonna do is
I'm gonna put the bowl on top and the
steam is going to heat the bowl and melt
the chocolate yes you can melt your
chocolate in the microwave but it's so
annoying because you have to take the
bowl out every 15 seconds and give it a
stir otherwise it might get too hot in
spots with a double boiler you can just
control it you're stirring it the whole
time and I think that it's just easier
in the long run to get the deepest
richest chocolate flavor you want to use
a dark chocolate that has a very high
cocoa percentage so when you're buying
the chocolate look for something that
says 60% or 70% cocoa solids and that
means there is more chocolate than sugar
that is beautiful okay so you know how
I'm going to cheat this recipe instead
of mixing all the dry ingredients
together in a bowl and then adding them
to the wet ingredients I'm just gonna
add them directly to the wet ingredients
the secret is add the flour last and
that way you're only gonna mix it a
little bit and you're not gonna overwork
the glutens it works perfectly dark
chocolate works really well with rye
flour because they're both very intense
flavors and that way neither one
dominates the other they just work well
together now is the part where I find my
small child and give her this because
otherwise I will eat it by myself
so these days it's der ger to add a
flaky sea salt on top of your brownies
but the fact is it actually does
something it really makes that chocolate
flavor just pop it can be really hard to
get your brownies perfectly done there's
a tendency to either over bake them or
to under bake them but what you're
looking for is the wobble you want it to
be solid but you want it to wobble so
you want to be able to see the center
just the very center shake a little bit
you'll feel solid on your fingers and
then when you test it with a toothpick
it's gonna come out looking wet but that
is okay that means if they're gonna be
moist and tender and not dry I love this
recipe because using rye flour and
brownies is no harder than using
all-purpose flour but it adds so much
more
